name: Left Adjoint Functor
definition: A **Functor** $F:C\to D$ is a **left adjoint** if there exists a functor $G:D\to C$ and a natural isomorphism $Hom_D(F(X),Y) \cong Hom_C(X,G(Y))$ for all $X$ in $C$, $Y$ in $D$.
description: A #functor is left adjoint if it is part of an adjunction as the left adjoint.
